categories.name: devs
categories.description: Tools and resources for software developers.

tools.name: .NET SDK
tools.description: A collection of tools and libraries to create applications based on the .NET platform.

tools.name: Android Studio
tools.description: IDE and toolkit for Android development.

tools.name: Docker
tools.description: The open source container service provider and basic tools for it, like docker-compose. Includes a container with Portainer CE for managing Docker from a web UI.

tools.name: Docker
tools.description: The open source container service provider and basic tools for it, like docker-compose. Includes a container with Portainer CE for managing Docker from a web UI.

tools.name: Godot Engine 4
tools.description: A popular open-source game engine for 2D and 3D game development. This version does not support Microsoft .NET (C#).

tools.name: Godot Engine 4 Sharp
tools.description: A popular open-source game engine for 2D and 3D game development with C# support. Includes .NET SDK.

tools.name: Insomnia
tools.description: A powerful REST API client with a sleek interface.

tools.name: Java OpenJDK
tools.description: Java JDK installation menu. Not needed if using Mise.

tools.name: JetBrains Toolbox
tools.description: A tool for managing JetBrains IDE installations.

tools.name: Maven
tools.description: A build automation tool used primarily for Java projects. Not needed if using Mise.

tools.name: Mise
tools.description: Like asdf (or nvm or pyenv but for any language) it manages dev tools like node, python, cmake, terraform, and hundreds more. Replaces PyEnv, NVM, and the Java JDK and Maven installers from this section.

tools.name: Visual Studio Code
tools.description: A powerful and feature-rich code editor by Microsoft.

tools.name: VSCodium
tools.description: An open-source version of Visual Studio Code, based on VSCode-OSS.
